entry.string: If you want to provide your own presentation here, you can specify a different layout="..." to use in the default template, or you can specify your own template="..." here as well.
You can then use those variables to build your own layout. The <xar:data-label ...> and <xar:data-output ...> tags allow you to show individual labels or value outputs in the template.
This uses dynamic module settings, i.e. you can add/remove settings for your module dynamically too. But you could use the 'normal' hard-coded approach here as well...
This tag will automatically retrieve the list of items from DynamicData, and present them according to its default objects/showlist.xd template.
After retrieving the object list via API, you can pass along the whole object list to the template and use <xar:data-list object="$mylist">,
or pass along the properties and values and work like in APPROACH # 2 - see the user view for an example of that.
This tag will automatically retrieve the item from DynamicData, and present it according to its standard objects/showdisplay.xd template.
You can then use that variable to build your own layout. The <xar:data-label ...> and <xar:data-output ...> tags allow you to show individual labels or value outputs in the template.

After retrieving the object via API, you can pass along the whole object to the template and use <xar:data-display object="$object" /> to let DynamicData handle the display. Or you can use <xar:data-display object="$object" tplmodule="dyn_example" /> if you want to provide your own display template in this module :
Notice for instance that you don't get the option to automatically display the image with <xar:data-output ... > or not here.
This tag will automatically retrieve the list of items from DynamicData, and present them according to its standard objects/showview.xd template.

Here's an example that uses the layout="list", and linkfield="name" to tell DynamicData which field should be linked to a display of the item. It also uses fieldlist="name,age" to show only a selected list of fields.
See the admin list for an example... We'll skip this one here, since we'll be retrieving 'properties' and 'values' via the module code instead, with the next approach.

After retrieving the object list via API, you can pass along the whole object list to the template and use <xar:data-view object="$mylist" /> to let DynamicData handle the view. Or you can use <xar:data-view object="$mylist" tplmodule="dyn_example" /> if you want to provide your own view template in this module :

Template : modules/dyn_example/xartemplates/objects/showdisplay-dyn_example.xd
This is a specific display template for the dyn_example object (if you want this) in the dyn_example module (if you want that)

Template : modules/dyn_example/xartemplates/objects/showform.xd
This is a generic form template for objects in the dyn_example module (if you want that)

Template : modules/dyn_example/xartemplates/objects/showlist.xd
This is a generic admin list template for objects in the dyn_example module (if you want that)

Template : modules/dyn_example/xartemplates/objects/showview-dyn_example.xd
This is a specific user view template for the dyn_example object (if you want this) in the dyn_example module (if you want that)
Please activate the Dynamic Data module first...
entry.translation: Bitte aktivieren Sie zuerst das DynamicData-Modul...
